titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Alfred Ernest Schuyler has been a botanist at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia since 1962. His research focuses on aquatic and wetland plants, including rare and endangered species, with particular emphasis on plants in the Delaware River Basin. Schuyler received his Ph.D. from the University of Michigan in 1963. He periodically teaches botany at Swarthmore College and occasionally offers short courses at local arboretums or for environmental consulting firms.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of notebooks of original descriptions, names, and types of selected Cyperaceae, compiled by A.E. Schuyler. There are ten notebooks with typed descriptions or excerpts of printed catalog entries and handwritten references. There are several packets of seeds pasted into the notebooks, and at least one photograph. The collection also includes a small batch of correspondence between Schuyler and Baruch Blumberg regarding Blumberg's donation of his herbarium to the Academy of Natural Sciences and Schuyler's identification of plants for Blumberg (1979-1992).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
